title: Royal Knowledge
introduction: Krishna reveals the most confidential knowledge - the path of devotion and how to remember Him in all circumstances.

shlokas.sanskrit: अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते | तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम् ||
shlokas.transliteration: ananyāś cintayanto māṁ ye janāḥ paryupāsate | teṣāṁ nityābhiyuktānāṁ yoga-kṣemaṁ vahāmy aham
shlokas.translation: To those who worship Me with devotion, meditating on Me constantly, I preserve what they have and provide what they lack.
shlokas.modern: When you're fully committed to your purpose, the universe conspires to help you. Not in a magical way, but because single-minded focus creates opportunities you'd otherwise miss. When you're 100% in, resources appear, people show up, doors open. It's not that you're lucky - it's that you're paying attention and ready. Commitment attracts support.

shlokas.sanskrit: यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत् | यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम् ||
shlokas.transliteration: yat karoṣi yad aśnāsi yaj juhoṣi dadāsi yat | yat tapasyasi kaunteya tat kuruṣva mad-arpaṇam
shlokas.translation: Whatever you do, whatever you eat, whatever you offer or give away, and whatever austerities you perform - do that as an offering to Me.
shlokas.modern: Make everything sacred. Cooking dinner? Do it with love. Going to work? See it as service. Even brushing your teeth can be an act of self-care and gratitude for your body. When you shift your perspective to see ordinary actions as meaningful, your whole life becomes spiritual practice. You don't need to be in a temple 24/7. You're always in the temple.
